Package edu.cornell.gdiac.json

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
edu.cornell.gdiac.json.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
public class GameController extends Object implements com.badlogic.gdx.Screen, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener
Gameplay controller for the game.

This class does not have the Box2d world. That is stored inside of the LevelModel object, as the world settings are determined by the JSON file. However, the class does have all of the controller functionality, including collision listeners for the active level.

You will notice that asset loading is very different. It relies on the singleton asset manager to manage the various assets.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController()
      Creates a new game world

      The physics bounds and drawing scale are now stored in the LevelModel and defined by the appropriate JSON file.

  • Method Details

      public boolean isComplete()
      Returns true if the level is completed.

      If true, the level will advance after a countdown

      Returns the canvas associated with this controller

      The canvas is shared across all controllers

      Returns:
      the GameCanvas associated with this controller

    • setCanvas

      public void setCanvas(GameCanvas canvas)
      Sets the canvas associated with this controller

      The canvas is shared across all controllers. Setting this value will compute the drawing scale from the canvas size.

      Parameters:
      canvas - the canvas associated with this controller

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Dispose of all (non-static) resources allocated to this mode.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    • gatherAssets

      public void gatherAssets(AssetDirectory directory)
      Gather the assets for this controller.

      This method extracts the asset variables from the given asset directory. It should only be called after the asset directory is completed.

      Parameters:
      directory - Reference to global asset manager.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the status of the game so that we can play again.

      This method disposes of the level and creates a new one. It will reread from the JSON file, allowing us to make changes on the fly.

    • preUpdate

      public boolean preUpdate(float dt)
      Returns whether to process the update loop

      At the start of the update loop, we check if it is time to switch to a new game mode. If not, the update proceeds normally.

      Parameters:
      dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame
      Returns:
      whether to process the update loop

    • update

      public void update(float dt)
      The core gameplay loop of this world.

      This method contains the specific update code for this mini-game. It does not handle collisions, as those are managed by the parent class WorldController. This method is called after input is read, but before collisions are resolved. The very last thing that it should do is apply forces to the appropriate objects.

      Parameters:
      dt - Number of seconds since last animation frame

    • draw

      public void draw(float delta)
      Draw the physics objects to the canvas

      For simple worlds, this method is enough by itself. It will need to be overriden if the world needs fancy backgrounds or the like.

      The method draws all objects in the order that they were added.

      Parameters:
      delta - The drawing context

    • resize

      public void resize(int width, int height)
      Called when the Screen is resized.

      This can happen at any point during a non-paused state but will never happen before a call to show().

      Specified by:
      resize in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
      Parameters:
      width - The new width in pixels
      height - The new height in pixels

    • render

      public void render(float delta)
      Called when the Screen should render itself.

      We defer to the other methods update() and draw(). However, it is VERY important that we only quit AFTER a draw.

      Specified by:
      render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen
      Parameters:
      delta - Number of seconds since last animation frame

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Called when the Screen is paused.

      This is usually when it's not active or visible on screen. An Application is also paused before it is destroyed.

      Specified by:
      pause in interface com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

      The ScreenListener will respond to requests to quit.

    • beginContact

      public void beginContact(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact)
      Callback method for the start of a collision

      This method is called when we first get a collision between two objects. We use this method to test if it is the "right" kind of collision. In particular, we use it to test if we made it to the win door.

      This is where we check for gum collisions

      Specified by:
      beginContact in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener
      Parameters:
      contact - The two bodies that collided

    • endContact

      public void endContact(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact)
      Callback method for the start of a collision

      This method is called when two objects cease to touch. The main use of this method is to determine when the characer is NOT on the ground. This is how we prevent double jumping.

      Specified by:
      endContact in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener

    • postSolve

      public void postSolve(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactImpulse impulse)
      Unused ContactListener method
      Specified by:
      postSolve in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener

    • preSolve

      public void preSolve(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Contact contact, com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Manifold oldManifold)
      Unused ContactListener method
      Specified by:
      preSolve in interface com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.ContactListener

    • playSound

      public long playSound(SoundEffect sound, long soundId)
      Method to ensure that a sound asset is only played once.

      Every time you play a sound asset, it makes a new instance of that sound. If you play the sounds to close together, you will have overlapping copies. To prevent that, you must stop the sound before you play it again. That is the purpose of this method. It stops the current instance playing (if any) and then returns the id of the new instance for tracking.

      Parameters:
      sound - The sound asset to play
      soundId - The previously playing sound instance
      Returns:
      the new sound instance for this asset.

    • playSound

      public long playSound(SoundEffect sound, long soundId, float volume)
      Method to ensure that a sound asset is only played once.

      Every time you play a sound asset, it makes a new instance of that sound. If you play the sounds to close together, you will have overlapping copies. To prevent that, you must stop the sound before you play it again. That is the purpose of this method. It stops the current instance playing (if any) and then returns the id of the new instance for tracking.

      Parameters:
      sound - The sound asset to play
      soundId - The previously playing sound instance
      volume - The sound volume
      Returns:
      the new sound instance for this asset.

    • createGumProjectile

      private void createGumProjectile(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 target)
      Add a new gum projectile to the world and send it in the right direction.

    • isGumObstacle

      private boolean isGumObstacle(Obstacle o)
      Returns true if an Obstacle is a gum projectile.

      An Obstacle is a gum projectile if its name equals "gumProjectile".

      Parameters:
      o - the Obstacle to check

    • resolveGumCollision

      private void resolveGumCollision(Obstacle bd1, Obstacle bd2)
      Handles a gum projectile's collision in the Box2D world.

      Examines two Obstacles in a collision. If either is a gum projectile, adds it to the Sticky Queue.

      Parameters:
      bd1 - The first Obstacle in the collision.
      bd2 - The second Obstacle in the collision.

    • createGumJoint

      private com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.joints.WeldJointDef createGumJoint(Obstacle gum, Obstacle ob)
      Returns a WeldJointDef connecting gum and another obstacle.
